meanings.definition: To adjust or prepare in advance.
meanings.sent1: I preattune my guitar before every performance.
meanings.sent2: She likes to preattune her schedule for the week on Sundays.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to preattune the ingredients for the recipe, but forgot the main one!
meanings.sent4: His mind was preattuned to the idea of success, making him more confident.
meanings.sent5: The athlete preattuned his body to the rhythm of the race, ready to sprint at the start.

meanings.sent1: Before the concert, the band members preattune their instruments together.
meanings.sent2: They always preattune their voices before singing in harmony.
meanings.sent3: The birds seemed to preattune their songs, creating a beautiful melody in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was preattuned to his, like two instruments playing the same tune.
meanings.sent5: The dancers preattuned their movements to the music, creating a mesmerizing performance.
